comments:
(eclipse version 3.1M3) 
Changes to Arrays.asList in Java 1.5/5.0 allows the use of Arrays.asList to
create an initialised List without first creating an array (see:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/Arrays.html#asList(T...) )

However, a class like this:

class TestError
{    
    java.util.List stooges = java.util.Arrays.asList("Larry", "Moe", "Curly");    
}

generates the following stack traces in .log

To workaround you can wrap the initialisation values in an array, as you would
in previous Java versions, 
(e.g. 
class TestError
{    
    java.util.List stooges = java.util.Arrays.asList(new String[] { "Larry",
"Moe", "Curly" } );    
}
but this is not correct behaviour.

This compiles fine latest and can be open in the java editor without an error.
Closing as WORKSFORME.
Still a bug in I20041201 build, but seems OK with I20041207 build.
